column4: Is there any chance to recover files that I had saved in a virtual machine?
Is there any chance to recover files that I had saved in a virtual machine?
is the virtual machine functional ATM?
you're referring to VMWare here, right?
I mean: My ubuntu doesn't start, so i've decided to re-install it, but I want to backup my work
I mean: My ubuntu doesn't start, so i've decided to re-install it, but I want to backup my work
why doesn't it boot? Where does it hang?
I'm not sure whether that is possible, i.e. whether you can pretend that the virtual disk is a hard disk-like block device or something
It lets me select the session, I mean the login screen, but then it gaves me a message about the session lasting less than 10 seconds
you're didn't tell us whether it's the underlying virtual machine that doesn't boot or whether it's the host system
why don't you login in safe mode (terminal-only, not GNOME)?
you can then look at ~/.xsession-errors for the issue
did you install any new software?
